meanings.definition: To make or become stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: She was stiffening the dough by adding more flour.
meanings.sent2: The old book's pages were stiffening with age.
meanings.sent3: The cat was stiffening its back in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was stiffening like steel in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The cold water caused an immediate stiffening of his muscles.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: The stiffening of the fabric made it difficult to fold.
meanings.sent2: He felt the stiffening of his joints as he got older.
meanings.sent3: The sudden stiffening of the balloon animal made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room created a palpable stiffening of the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The stiffening of the tree branches signaled the arrival of winter.
